radiographic_examinations.findings: Substantial volume loss within the right hemithorax, elevation of the hemidiaphragm, shift of the heart and mediastinum toward the right, hyperinflated left lung herniated over to the right, right hilum not well seen, enlarged left hilum, pleural thickening superolaterally, fine reticular markings in the peripheral right lung, suggestion of rib notching.

Prominence of the left main pulmonary artery and its divisions, complete absence of the mediastinal portion of the right main pulmonary artery, small interlobar portion of the right pulmonary artery, enhanced intercostal arteries supplying collateral circulation to the right lung, normal bronchial branching pattern and no evidence of bronchiectasis.
